title: Can philosophy be an object? - Quora

response.answer_text: In a sentence it is. Is this question about grammar? The subject of the sentence is philosophy. To make it the object, do this: Can an object be a philosophy? The answer to THAT question is no. An object can be a subject of a philosophy, but not the other way around.

I would have to say that this question needs to be clarified and placed in context in order to respond. Otherwise I would say no it can’t. It is a subject. In the most obvious way it is distinctly unlike an object. Even dictionary definitions of these words suffice to respond. Hope this helps.
